Label: Apoptosis, stress-related metabolism, cell growth inhibition
Pyrrole
Comment: pyrrole is not the major decomposition product of proline under smoking conditions

Label: Prolino+fructose
Comment: The addition of proline + fructose in Burley tobacco reduced typical Burley harshness and provided some sweetness, thereby confirming the evaluation made by F. Aramendy and S. Battram (see above). On the other hand, addition of proline + fructose in FC tobacco showed no significant difference at 95% confidence level. </br>•
column6: The addition of proline plus fructose or prolinofructose enhances nutty/roasted notes in distillation in both cut-filler and tobacco extrudate most likely due, based on GC-O analyses, to the formation of 2-acetyl-1-pyrroline (pop-corn) in the aerosol

Label: Spermidine
Comment: used in tobacco, in thermal desorbtion, in comb. with 2-oxopropanol

Label: L-ornithine
Comment: Present even in smoke</br>when ornithine was used in a thermal desorber, traces amounts of 2AP were formed

Label: Arginine
Comment: Not found in smoke</br>N storage form in plants

Label: 2-oxopropanal
Comment: this is the active sugar fragment in the formation of 2AP

Label: L-Glutamic acid
Comment: one of the major sources of free aa in burley</br>Present even in smoke

Label: L-Proline
Comment: Proline in burley: Sweet, caramelized, slightly ash like, rather flat

Label: Proline in FC: Slightly phenolic, smokey, nutty/ pyrazine, meaty, slightly green/ vegetable, acidic
Type: Smoky, ashes like, toasted, earthy</br>Present even in Smoke (Schmeltz and Hoffman, 1977)</br>increase (anomaly) during curing for both FC and AC</br>More proline in green does not translate into more proline in cured (Bovet et al., 2010, Q2 report)
